## ResourceManager.loadTextureFromBuffer() method

Load a texture directly from an ArrayBuffer or typed array.

- Chooses an appropriate loader based on the provided MIME type. - Can upload into an existing texture if `texture` is specified.

**Signature:**

```typescript
loadTextureFromBuffer<T extends BaseTexture>(arrayBuffer: ArrayBuffer | TypedArray, mimeType: string, srgb?: boolean, samplerOptions?: SamplerOptions, texture?: BaseTexture): Promise<T>;
```

</th><th>

Type

Description

arrayBuffer


</td><td>

ArrayBuffer \| [TypedArray](doc/markdown/./base.typedarray.md)


</td><td>

Raw texture data buffer.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

mimeType


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

MIME type of the texture (must be supported by a registered loader).


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

srgb


</td><td>

boolean


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ If true, treat image as sRGB; otherwise linear.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

samplerOptions


</td><td>

[SamplerOptions](doc/markdown/./device.sampleroptions.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Optional sampler options passed to the loader path.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

texture


</td><td>

[BaseTexture](doc/markdown/./device.basetexture.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Optional destination texture to populate.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

Promise&lt;T&gt;

A promise that resolves to the created or populated texture.
